page.title: 05Employment in Llangennech
page.content: By now{Llangennech}has lost its place as one of the busiest of the small industrial villages of Wales. Until recently there were two industries of great importance and value to the community, the NCB Morlais Colliery and The Royal Naval Stores Depot. Both provided employment for a large percentage of the village. By now the colliery has closed and the whole site is in the process of being cleared, and it appears according to Government statements that the RN Stores Depot will also close in the near future. There has been an increase lately in the private sector building industry, and four new housing estates have or are being built within the village boundary. The majority of the village working population travels to Llanelli.
